titleStmt.title: Laws and acts past in the second session of the second Parliament, of our most high and dread soveraign, Charles the second, by the grace of God, King of Scotland, England, France, and Ireland, defender of the faith Holden at Edinburgh, from the 28. of July, to the 22. of August, 1670. By a noble earl, John Earl of Lauderdail, Viscount Maitland, Lord Thirlestane and Bolton, &c. His Majesties Commissioner, &c.
Acts. 1670
titleStmt.author: Scotland.

publicationStmt.publisher: re-printed by Andrew Anderson, printer to the King's most excellent Majesty,

notesStmt.note: At foot of title page: Cum privilegio.
Imperfect: last page cropped at foot with loss of text.
Reproduction of original in the Folger Shakespeare Library, Washington, D.C..
